tuv.seg: • What should I do if my child is at risk of abduction?
• Cad ba chóir dom a dhéanamh má cheapaim go bhfuil mo leanbh i gcontúirt a fhuadaithe?
When a child is removed from the person who has the legal right to custody of the child without that person’s consent it is called child abduction
Nuair a thógtar leanbh ón duine a bhfuil an ceart dlíthiúil aige/aici ar chaomhnóireacht an linbh sin gan toiliú an duine, glaoitear fuadach leanaí air sin
When the child is taken out of the country or is kept in another country they are visiting it is called international child abduction
Nuair a thógtar an leanbh amach as an tír nó má choinnítear é/í i dtír eile a bhfuil sé/sé ag tabhairt cuairte air tugtar fuadach idirnáisiúnta leanaí air sin
There are two main aspects to international child abduction as follows:
Tá dhá phríomhghné ag baint le fuadach idirnáisiúnta leanaí mar seo a leanas:
• International child abduction is a criminal offence in Ireland
• Is cion coiriúil é fuadach idirnáisiúnta leanaí in Éirinn
A parent or anyone else who unlawfully abducts a child may be convicted of the offence
Is féidir tuismitheoir nó aon duine eile a fhuadaíonn leanbh go neamhdhleathach a chúiseamh as an gcion
(See 'Criminal offence' below)
(Féach “Cion coiriúil” thíos)
• The question of arranging for the return of a child who has been abducted internationally is governed by international law
• Rialaíonn an dlí idirnáisiúnta an cheist maidir leis an leanbh a ndearnadh fuadach idirnáisiúnta air/uirthi a thabhairt ar ais abhaile
There are international Conventions and a European Union (EU) Regulation which set out the rules that apply
Tá Coinbhinsiúin idirnáisiúnta agus Rialachán de chuid an Aontais Eorpaigh (AE) ann a leagann amach na rialacha atá i bhfeidhm
The EU Regulation applies to an abduction from one EU member state to another
Tá feidhm leis an Rialachán AE i gcás fuadach a dhéantar as ballstát amháin de chuid an AE chuig ceann eile
An international Convention applies to cases to which the EU Regulation does not apply
Baineann Coinbhinsiún idirnáisiúnta le cásanna nach bhfuil feidhm le Rialachán an AE iontu
(See 'Return of the child' below)
(Féach “Filleadh an linbh” thíos)
What is child abduction?
Cad is fuadach leanaí ann?
Child abduction is the term used to describe a situation where a child is removed from the person who has the legal right to custody without that person’s consent

Is éard is fuadach leanaí ná an téarma a úsáidtear chun cur síos a dhéanamh ar chás ina dtógtar leanbh ón duine a bhfuil an ceart dlíthiúil aige/aici ar chaomhnóireacht agus déantar é gan toiliú an duine sin
International child abduction occurs when a child is:
Tarlaíonn fuadach idirnáisiúnta leanaí nuair a tharlaíonn sé seo a leanas don leanbh:
• Taken out of the country in which the child and the person who has the legal right to custody normally live (the child is unlawfully removed from a country)
• Tógtar é/í amach as an tír ina bhfuil gnáthchónaí air/uirthi agus ar an duine a bhfuil an ceart dlíthiúil aige/aici ar a c(h)aomhnóireacht (tógtar an leanbh amach as tír go neamhdhleathach)
• Kept in another country where the child is visiting (the child is unlawfully retained in a country)
• Coinnítear an leanbh i dtír eile áit a bhfuil an leanbh ar cuairt (coinnítear an leanbh i dtír go neamhdhleathach)
The abductor may be any person but frequently is one of the child’s parents
D’fhéadfadh aon duine a bheith i gceist leis an bhfuadaitheoir ach is minic gur duine de thuismitheoirí an linbh a bhíonn i gceist
For example, a child who is in the custody of his mother in Ireland and who is visited here by his father may be abducted from here and unlawfully removed by his father

Mar shampla, d’fhéadfaí leanbh a bhfuil caomhnóireacht ag a m(h)áthair air/uirthi in Éirinn agus a dtugann a (h)athair cuairt air/uirthi anseo a fhuadach as an tír seo agus a bheith tógtha go neamhdhleathach ag a (h)athair

A child who is in the custody of his father in Ireland may go to visit his mother in the USA and, if she keeps him there beyond the agreed visiting time, he has been abducted and is unlawfully retained by his mother

D'fhéadfaí leanbh a bhfuil caomhnóireacht ag a (h)athair air/uirthi in Éirinn dul ar cuairt chuig a m(h)áthair i SAM agus, má choinníonn sí é/í thar an am atá aontaithe don chuairt, tá sé/sí fuadaithe agus á c(h)oinneáil go neamhdhleathach ag a m(h)áthair
So, an abduction may involve the wrongful removal or the wrongful retention of a child
Mar sin, d’fhéadfadh tógáil éagórach nó coinneáil éagórach linbh a bheith i gceist le fuadach
The Non-Fatal Offences against the Person Act 1997 deals with the crime of international child abduction
Déileálann an tAcht um Chionta Neamh-Mharfacha in aghaidh an Duine 1997 leis an gcoir a bhaineann le fuadach idirnáisiúnta leanaí
Section 16 of the Act applies if you are a parent, guardian or a person to whom custody of the child has been granted by a court
Tá feidhm le hAlt 16 den Acht más tuismitheoir, caomhnóir nó duine tú a bhfuil caomhnóireacht an linbh bronnta ort ag cúirt
It does not apply to you if you are a parent who is not a guardian of the child
Ní bhíonn feidhm leis an alt más tuismitheoir tú nach bhfuil i do chaomhnóir ar an leanbh
It applies if you unlawfully send or keep a child under the age of 16 out of the State or if you cause a child to be unlawfully taken, sent or kept

Bíonn feidhm leis an alt má chuireann tú nó má choinníonn tú leanbh faoi aois 16 go neamhdhleathach amuigh as an Stát nó más tú is cúis le leanbh a thógáil, a chur amach nó a choinneáil go neamhdhleathach
Unlawfully means in defiance of a court order or without the consent of the other parent or guardian
Ciallaíonn rud a dhéanamh go neamhdhleathach rud a dhéanamh d'ainneoin ordú cúirte nó rud a dhéanamh gan toiliú tuismitheora nó caomhnóra
Section 17 applies to people who are not covered by Section 16 and who unlawfully detain a child or cause a child to be detained
Bíonn feidhm le hAlt 17 i gcás daoine nach bhfuil clúdaithe ag Alt 16 agus a choinníonn leanbh go neamhdhleathach nó atá ina chúis le leanbh a choinneáil
The main concern in international child abduction cases is the return of the child
Is é an príomhchúram a bhaineann le cásanna fuadaithe idirnáisiúnta leanaí ná an leanbh a thabhairt ar ais
The international conventions and the EU Regulation which govern the return of the child are all based on similar principles
Tá na coinbhinsiúin idirnáisiúnta agus an Rialachán AE a rialaíonn filleadh an linbh bunaithe ar na prionsabail chéanna
• The child should be returned to his/her habitual residence as soon as possible
• Ba chóir an leanbh a thabhairt ar ais chuig a g(h)náth-áit chónaithe chomh luath agus is féidir
• The courts of the jurisdiction in which the child is habitually resident are the appropriate courts to decide what is in the best interests of the child
• Is iad cúirteanna na dlínse ina bhfuil gnáthchónaí ar an leanbh na cúirteanna cuí chun cinneadh a dhéanamh faoi cad is fearr a rachaidh chun leasa an linbh
So, if there are any disputes about, for example, access, custody, maintenance, these disputes should be decided in the country where the child is habitually resident
Mar sin, má bhíonn aon díospóidí ann faoi, mar shampla, rochtain, caomhnóireacht nó cothabháil, ba chóir na díospóidí sin a shocrú sa tír ina bhfuil gnáthchónaí ar an leanbh
There is a Central Authority in each country to facilitate the return of abducted children
Tá Lárúdarás i ngach tír chun filleadh an linbh fhuadaithe a éascú
EU Regulation on international abduction of children
Rialachán an AE um fhuadach idirnáisiúnta leanaí
The EU has a limited role in family law matters
Tá ról teoranta ag an AE i gcúrsaí dlí teaghlaigh
Each individual member state has its own rules about separation, divorce, maintenance of spouses and children, custody and guardianship and other family law matters
Tá a chuid rialacha féin ag gach ballstát aonair maidir le scaradh, colscaradh, cothabháil céilí agus leanaí, caomhnóireacht agus cúrsaí dlí teaghlaigh eile
The role of the EU is mainly concerned with ensuring that decisions made in one country can be implemented in another
Is é ról an AE go príomha ná a chinntiú gur féidir cinntí a dhéantar i dtír amháin a chur i bhfeidhm i dtír eile
It also has a role in trying to establish which country has jurisdiction to hear a particular case
Tá ról freisin ag an AE ó thaobh cinneadh a dhéanamh cén tír ag a bhfuil dlínse chun éisteacht le cás ar leith
You can find out more about EU legislation on family law in our document, EU and family law
Is féidir leat tuilleadh a fháil amach faoi reachtaíocht an AE ar dhlí teaghlaigh inár ndoiciméad, An AE agus dlí teaghlaigh

The Council Regulation (EC) No 2201/2003 on jurisdiction and the recognition and enforcement of judgments in matrimonial matters and the matters of parental responsibility came into effect in March 2005

Tháinig Rialachán (CE) Uimh. 2201/2003 ón gComhairle maidir le dlínse agus breithiúnais a aithint agus a fhorfheidhmiú i gcúrsaí pósta agus cúrsaí a bhaineann le freagracht tuismitheoirí i bhfeidhm i mí an Mhárta 2005
The Regulation covers the following aspects of parental responsibility:
Clúdaíonn an Rialachán na gnéithe seo a leanas d’fhreagracht tuismitheoirí:
• Jurisdiction – what country should hear the case, whose laws should apply
• Dlínse - cén tír ar chóir an cás a éisteacht inti, cén dlíthe ar chóir a bheith i bhfeidhm
• Recognition and enforcement – how decisions made in one country are to be recognised and enforced in another
• Aitheantas agus forfheidhmiú - conas a thabharfar aitheantas agus a dhéanfar forfheidhmiú ar chinntí a dhéantar i dtír amháin i dtír eile
• Specific rules on child abduction and access rights
• Rialacha sonracha ar fhuadach leanaí agus ar chearta rochtana
The regulation does not set an age limit – that is for the individual country to decide
Ní leagann an rialachán teorainn aoise síos - is faoin tír aonair é sin a shocrú
In general, the age limit is 18
Is 18 an teorainn aoise go ginearálta
It applies only to civil proceedings, not criminal cases
Baineann sé le himeachtaí sibhialta amháin, ní le cásanna coiriúla

The court in the member state of the child’s habitual residence before the abduction retains jurisdiction to deal with the case except in certain limited circumstances, for example, where all concerned have acquiesced in the abduction

Coinníonn an chúirt sa bhallstát ina raibh gnáthchónaí ar an leanbh roimh an bhfuadach dlínse chun déileáil leis an gcás ach amháin i gcúinsí teoranta áirithe, mar shampla, sa chás gur ghéill gach duine lena mbaineann san fhuadach
The Regulation creates a system of co-operation between Central Authorities of the member states
Cruthaíonn an Rialachán córas comhoibrithe idir Lárúdaráis na mballstát
These authorities are obliged to facilitate communications between the courts of the relevant countries and must facilitate agreements between parents through mediation or other means
Tá sé d’oibleagáid ar na húdaráis seo cumarsáid a éascú idir cúirteanna na dtíortha ábhartha agus caithfidh siad comhaontuithe a éascú idir na tuismitheoirí trí idirghabháil nó trí bhealaí eile
Judgements given in one member state must be recognised and enforced in another member state
Caithfear breithiúnais a thugtar i mballstát amháin a aithint agus a fhorfheidhmiú i mballstát eile
The court in the other member state may refuse to recognise the order only on certain grounds
Is féidir leis an gcúirt sa bhallstát eile diúltú aitheantas a thabhairt don ordú ach ní féidir é sin a dhéanamh ach ar fhorais áirithe
In the cases of child abduction, it is not necessary to go through the court procedure for recognition
I gcásanna ina bhfuadaítear leanbh, ní gá dul trí imeacht cúirte chun aitheantas a fháil
If you have custody of a child and your child is abducted to another member state, you may apply to that state for the return of the child
Má tá caomhnóireacht agat ar leanbh agus má fhuadaítear do leanbh chuig ballstát eile, féadfaidh tú iarratas a dhéanamh chuig an stát sin chun an leanbh a fháil ar ais

The court of the member state to which the child has been abducted can only refuse return of the child in limited circumstances – for example, if there are not adequate safeguards to ensure that there is no serious risk of harm to the child should the child return

Ní féidir le cúirt an bhallstáit chuig a bhfuadaítear an leanbh diúltú don leanbh a thabhairt ar ais ach i gcúinsí teoranta - mar shampla, mura bhfuil cosaintí imleora ann lena chinntiú nach bhfuil aon riosca tromchúiseach ann go ndéanfar dochar don leanbh sa chás go bhfillfeadh sé/sí
In general, the court must order the immediate return of the child
Go ginearálta, caithfidh an chúirt ordú a thabhairt go dtabharfaí an leanbh ar ais láithreach
Under the Hague Convention (see below), the court is not obliged to order the return if it would expose the child to physical or psychological harm, or put him/her in an intolerable situation

Faoi Choinbhinsiún na Háige (féach thíos), níl sé d’oibleagáid ar an gcúirt ordú a thabhairt an leanbh a thabhairt ar ais sa chás go mbeadh an leanbh i gcontúirt fhisiciúil nó shíceolaíochta, nó go gcuirfí i gcás dofhulaingthe é/í

The EU Regulation requires the return of the child where that could expose the child to such harm, provided the authorities in the member state of origin have made or are prepared to make adequate arrangements to insure the protection of the child after the return

Éilíonn an Rialachán AE go dtabharfaí an leanbh ar ais sa chás go bhféadfaí dochar den sórt sin a dhéanamh don leanbh, ar an gcoinníoll go ndearna nó go bhfuil na húdaráis sa bhallstát tionscnaimh ullmhaithe chun socruithe cuí a dhéanamh lena chinntiú go bhfaighidh an leanbh cosaint tar éis dó/di filleadh
The Regulation provides for the right of the child to be heard during the procedure unless the judge considers it inappropriate due to the child’s age and degree of maturity
Forálann an Rialachán go bhfuil sé de cheart ag an leanbh éisteacht a fháil le linn an nós imeachta mura measann an breitheamh go bhfuil sé míchuí mar gheall ar aois agus aibíocht an linbh
The court cannot refuse to return the child without first giving the person who requested the return the opportunity to be heard
Ní féidir leis an gcúirt diúltú an leanbh a thabhairt ar ais gan deis a thabhairt ar dtús don duine a d’iarr go dtabharfaí an leanbh ar ais éisteacht a fháil
In general, the decision must be made within 6 weeks
Go hiondúil, caithfear an cinneadh a dhéanamh laistigh de 6 seachtaine
Further information on the EU Regulation is available in the Practice Guide for the Application of Council Regulation (EC) No
Tá tuilleadh eolais maidir le Rialachán an AE le fáil sa Practice Guide for the Application of Council Regulation (EC) No

The Hague Convention of 25 October 1980 on the civil aspects of international child abduction (the 1980 Hague Convention) and the Hague Convention (1996) on jurisdiction, applicable law, recognition, enforcement and cooperation in respect of parental responsibility and measures for the protection of children continue to apply in cases where the EU Regulation does not

Tá feidhm i gcónaí le Coinbhinsiún na Háige an 25 Deireadh Fómhair 1980 maidir le gnéithe sibhialta de fhuadach idirnáisiúnta leanaí (Coinbhinsiún na Háige 1980) agus le Coinbhinsiún na Háige (1996) maidir le dlínse, dlí infheidhmithe, aitheantas, forfheidhmiú agus comhoibriú i ndáil le freagracht tuismitheoirí agus bearta chun leanaí a chosaint i gcásanna nach bhfuil feidhm le Rialachán an AE
The EU Regulation prevails over the Convention in relation to those aspects covered by the Regulation
Tá tús áite ag Rialachán an AE ar an gCoinbhinsiún maidir leis na gnéithe sin arna gclúdach ag an Rialachán
The Convention and the Regulation are generally similar in scope and in rules
Tá an Coinbhinsiún agus an Rialachán cosúil lena chéile tríd is tríd ó thaobh scóip agus rialacha de

The European Convention on Recognition and Enforcement of Decisions Concerning Custody of Children and on Restoration of Custody of Children (the Luxembourg Convention) was signed in 1980 and applies to a number of European countries

Síníodh Coinbhinsiún na hEorpa um Aitheantas agus Forfheidhmiú ar Chinntí Maidir le Caomhnóireacht Leanaí agus Athchóiriú Caomhnóireachta Leanaí (Coinbhinsiún Lucsamburg) i 1980 agus tá feidhm leis i roinnt tíortha san Eoraip
It is now of limited relevance because the EU Regulation or the Hague Convention covers the relevant countries
Is beag aitheantais atá aige anois de bhrí go gclúdaíonn Rialachán an AE nó Coinbhinsiún na Háige na tíortha ábhartha
Both the Hague and Luxembourg Conventions deal with children under the age of 16 and provide that the paramountcy principle applies – that means the welfare of the child is of paramount importance

Déileálann Coinbhinsiúin na Háige agus Lucsamburg le leanaí faoi aois 16 agus foráiltear iontu go bhfuil feidhm leis an bprionsabal tábhachta - rud a chiallaíonn go mbeidh tábhacht ag leas an linbh thar aon ní eile
The list of countries which are enforcing the Hague Convention is available on the Hague Conference on Private International Law website
Tá liosta na dtíortha atá ag forfheidhmiú Choinbhinsiún na Háige le fáil ar láithreán gréasáin Choinbhinsiún na Háige um Dhlí Idirnáisiúnta Príobháideach
Countries who have not agreed to the conventions
Tíortha nár aontaigh leis na coinbhinsiúin
In the case of countries which are not party to any of the international Conventions, decisions are made on the basis of private international law
I gcás tíortha nach bhfuil mar pháirtí ag aon cheann de na Coinbhinsiúin idirnáisiúnta, déantar cinntí bunaithe ar an dlí idirnáisiúnta príobháideach
This means that, in general, the Irish courts recognise court orders made in jurisdictions with similar legal systems
Ciallaíonn sé sin, tríd is tríd, go dtugann cúirteanna na hÉireann aitheantas d’orduithe cúirte a dhéantar i ndlínse ina bhfuil córais dhlí den chineál céanna
The courts also take into account the requirements of the Guardianship of Infants Acts that the child’s welfare and best interests are assessed
Tógann na cúirteanna san áireamh freisin riachtanais na nAchtanna um Chaomhnóireacht Naíon ionas go ndéantar measúnú ar folláine agus ar an leas is fearr don leanbh
On occasions, the Irish courts have refused to return a child to a jurisdiction where this might involve a breach of rights under the Constitution of Ireland
Tharla sé ó am go ham gur dhiúltaigh cúirteanna na hÉireann leanbh a thabhairt ar ais chuig dlínse sa chás go bhféadfadh sárú ceart a bheith i gceist faoi Bhunreacht na hÉireann
Irish law on child abduction
Dlí na hÉireann maidir le fuadach leanaí
The Child Abduction and Enforcement of Court Orders Act 1991 came into force in Ireland in October 1991
Tháinig an tAcht um Fhuadach Leanaí agus Forghníomhú Orduithe Coimeádta 1991 i bhfeidhm in Éirinn i mí Dheireadh Fómhair 1991
It brought into Irish law the Hague Convention and the Luxembourg Convention
Rinne sé dlí de Choinbhinsiún na Háige agus de Choinbhinsiún Lucsamburg in Éirinn
Both Conventions aim to return the child who has been abducted
Tá sé mar aidhm ag an dá Choinbhinsiún an leanbh atá fuadaithe a thabhairt ar ais
The Hague Convention can operate even if there is no court order, if the child is taken without the consent of one parent
Is féidir le Coinbhinsiún na Háige feidhmiú fiú amháin nuair nach bhfuil aon ordú cúirte ann má tógadh an leanbh gan toiliú tuismitheora amháin

The Luxembourg Convention operates if there is a court order determining custody and it provides for the mutual recognition and enforcement of such orders in the countries which are parties to the Convention

Feidhmíonn Coinbhinsiún Lucsamburg má tá ordú cúirte ann a shocraíonn caomhnóireacht agus foráiltear ann go mbeadh comhaitheantas ann d’orduithe den sórt sin agus go ndéanfar forfheidhmiú orthu sna tíortha atá mar pháirtithe ag an gCoinbhinsiún
The countries which are parties to the Conventions agree to be bound by certain procedures in cases where children are removed from one country to another:
Aontaíonn na tíortha atá ina bpáirtithe ag na Coinbhinsiúin a bheith faoi cheangal ag nósanna imeachta áirithe i gcásanna nuair a thógtar leanaí amach as tír amháin isteach i dtír eile:

• If a child (aged under 16) is taken to or from a country which is a party to the Conventions in defiance of a court order or against the wishes of a parent who has been granted custody, the Central Authority in that country may help to have the child returned

• Má thógtar leanbh (faoi 16) chuig nó amach as tír atá mar pháirtí ag na Coinbhinsiúin d’ainneoin ordú cúirte nó in aghaidh toil tuismitheora a bhfuil caomhnóireacht bronnta air/uirthi, is féidir leis an Lárúdarás sa tír sin cabhrú chun an leanbh a fháil ar ais
For Ireland, the Central Authority is the Department of Justice and Equality
I gcás na hÉireann, is í an Roinn Dlí agus Cirt agus Comhionannais an Lárúdarás

• If a child is abducted into a country which is a party to the Conventions, the Central Authority will take steps to trace the child, try to return the child or get access to the child and if necessary, take court proceedings to achieve that

• Má fhuadaítear leanbh isteach i dtír atá ina páirtí ar na Coinbhinsiúin, tógfaidh an Lárúdarás céimeanna chun an leanbh a aimsiú, déanfaidh sé iarracht an leanbh a fháil ar ais nó gheobhaidh sé rochtain ar an leanbh agus más gá, cuirfidh sé imeachtaí cúirte ar bun chun é sin a dhéanamh
If a child is abducted into Ireland, the Department of Justice and Equality may ask the Legal Aid Board to take proceedings in the High Court
Má fhuadaítear leanbh isteach go hÉirinn, féadfaidh an Roinn Dlí agus Cirt agus Comhionannais iarraidh ar an mBord um Chúnamh Dlíthiúil imeachtaí a chur ar bun san Ard-Chúirt
Legal aid will be available
Beidh cúnamh dlí ar fáil
Under the Hague Convention, it is possible to negotiate a voluntary settlement of the issues
Faoi Choinbhinsiún na Háige, is féidir idirbheartaíocht a dhéanamh chun na ceisteanna a réiteach go deonach
If a child has been abducted from the State, the Central Authority will help the parent in seeking the return of the child and liaise with other Central Authorities to that end
Má tá leanbh fuadaithe as an Stát, cuideoidh an Lárúdarás leis an tuismitheoir iarracht a dhéanamh an leanbh a fháil ar ais agus labhairt le Lárúdaráis eile chuige sin
The Act also outlines the circumstances in which a child need not be returned and the various procedures involved in enforcement
Tá cuntas san Acht freisin ar na himthosca nach gá an leanbh a thabhairt ar ais agus na nósanna imeachta éagsúla a bhaineann le forfheidhmiú

It also gives power to the Gardaí to detain a child if they suspect that the child is being removed from the State in breach of any custody order or while proceedings in relation to custody are in train

Tugann sé cumhacht freisin do na Gardaí chun leanbh a choinneáil má tá amhras orthu go bhfuil an leanbh á thógáil amach as an Stát agus sárú á dhéanamh ar aon ordú caomhnóireachta nó fad is atá imeachtaí maidir le caomhnóireacht ag dul ar aghaidh
If your child has been internationally abducted, you should contact the Central Authority in order to set in motion the procedures required in the country to which the child has been abducted
Má tá fuadach idirnáisiúnta déanta ar do leanbh, ba chóir duit dul i dteagmháil leis an Lárúdarás d’fhonn na nósanna imeachta a theastaíonn sa tír chuig a bhfuil an leanbh fuadaithe a chur ar bun
The European Parliament Mediator for International Parental Child Abduction
Idirghabhálaí Pharlaimint na hEorpa um Fhuadach Idirnáisiúnta Leanaí arna dhéanamh ag an Tuismitheoir
The post of the European Parliament Mediator for International Parental Child Abduction was created in 1987
Cruthaíodh post Idirghabhálaí Pharlaimint na hEorpa um Fhuadach Idirnáisiúnta Leanaí arna dhéanamh ag an Tuismitheoir i 1987
It has no statutory basis
Níl aon bhunús reachtúil aige
It aims to help children who have been abducted by one parent in circumstances where the parents are of different nationality and the marriage has broken down
Tá sé mar aidhm aige cuidiú le leanaí a ndearna tuismitheoir amháin fuadach orthu in imthosca áirithe áit a bhfuil náisiúntacht dhifriúil ag na tuismitheoirí agus go bhfuil an pósadh briste
Either parent may ask the Mediator to get involved
Féadfaidh aon tuismitheoir acu iarraidh ar an Idirghabhálaí cabhrú leo
The Mediator tries to find a voluntary agreement between the parents
Déanann an tIdirghabhálaí iarracht teacht ar shocrú deonach idir na tuismitheoirí
This is done by providing information and advice and arranging suitable mediators for the particular case
Déantar é sin trí fhaisnéis agus comhairle a chur ar fáil agus idirghabhálaithe oiriúnacha a fhostú don chás áirithe sin
The Mediator tries to ensure that there is the following combination of mediators: one woman - one man, one lawyer - one non-lawyer, both speaking both languages of the parties in the dispute

Déanann na hIdirghabhálaithe iarracht a chinntiú go bhfuil an meascán seo a leanas d’idirghabhálaithe ann: bean amháin - fear amháin, dlíodóir amháin, duine nach dlíodóir é/í, beirt atá in ann an dá theanga atá ag na páirtithe sa díospóid a labhairt
The Mediator is concerned to ensure the best interests of the child
Tá cúram ar an Idirghabhálaí a chinntiú go dtugtar tús áit do leas an linbh
There is no requirement for either parent to co-operate with the Mediator
Ní gá d’aon tuismitheoir comhoibriú leis an Idirghabhálaí
If they do co-operate and reach an agreement, that agreement may be turned into a legally enforceable agreement
Mura gcomhoibríonn siad agus má thagann siad ar shocrú, féadfar comhaontú atá infheidhmithe de réir an dlí a dhéanamh den chomhaontú sin
This is the case for any agreement reached after mediation
Tarlaíonn sé sin i gcás aon chomhaontú a dhéantar tar éis idirghabhála
What should I do if my child is at risk of abduction?
Cad ba chóir dom a dhéanamh má cheapaim go bhfuil mo leanbh i gcontúirt a fhuadaithe?
If you believe your child is at risk of abduction you should get legal advice or contact the Gardaí
Má chreideann tú go bhfuil baol ann go bhfuadófar do leanbh ba chóir duit comhairle dlí a fháil nó dul i dteagmháil leis na Gardaí
The Irish Centre for Parentally Abducted Children (ICPAC) published an ICPAC Prevention Pack (pdf) which provides information on the steps you should take if your child is at risk of abduction

D’fhoilsigh Ionad na hÉireann do Leanaí arna bhFuadach ag Tuismitheoir (ICPAC) ICPAC Prevention Pack (pdf) (Pacáiste Coiscthe) a thugann eolas ar na céimeanna ba chóir duit a ghlacadh má tá baol ann go bhfuadófar do leanbh
This includes advice on gathering important information relating to your child, which will be required if your child is abducted, as well as on other steps you can take to reduce the risk

Tá comhairle sa phacáiste maidir le heolas tábhachtach a bhaineann le do leanbh a bhailiú, rud a theastóidh uait má fhuadaítear do leanbh, chomh maith le céimeanna eile is féidir leat a ghlacadh chun an baol a laghdú
Reunite International, a UK charity, also provides child abduction prevention guides on its website
Chomh maith leis sin, tá treoracha chosc fuadach leanaí ar láithreán gréasáin Reunite International, carthanas Ríocht Aontaithe
The Central Authority in Ireland for international child abduction is the Department of Justice and Equality
Tá an Roinn Dlí agus Cirt agus Comhionannais an tÚdarás Lárnach in Éirinn do fuadach idirnáisiúnta leanaí
